definition: a hoe/to hoe or dig/to weed/to get rid of

sentences.english: I have to feed the chickens and hoe the potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 我得餵雞，還得爲馬鈴薯鋤草。

sentences.english: I would rather hoe in the garden than run on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 我寧願在花園裏鋤草，不願在運動場上跑來跑去。

sentences.english: I would rather hoe in the garden than run about on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 我寧願在花園裏鋤草，不願在運動場上跑來跑去。

sentences.english: Or a man with a mule would plow the field of his neighbor in exchange for help in weeding his own land.
sentences.chinese: 有騾子的人替鄰居耕地，鄰居則幫他鋤草作爲交換。

sentences.english: It's advisable to use a lawn mower instead of scissors to cut his manes.
sentences.chinese: 聰明點還是用鋤草機剪他這一頭鬃毛吧，別用剪刀了。

sentences.english: Jenkins then found a case of beer strapped to the lawnmower 's front, court records show.
sentences.chinese: 簡金斯發現，鋤草機正前方捆綁著一籮筐的啤酒。

sentences.english: Every morning you can see him cultivating the corn.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨你都可以看見他在給玉米鋤草鬆土。

sentences.english: This evening we went over to our garden to harvest. Jeff was mowing the loan.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚智傑鋤草，我就順這機會驗收一下菜園。

sentences.english: When Shun cultivated in Mount Li, elephants ploughed for him while birds weeded for him.
sentences.chinese: 舜在厲山耕種，大象替他耕地，鳥代他鋤草。

sentences.english: Then she weeded in the garden while waited for her husband.
sentences.chinese: 然後她一邊在花園鋤草一邊等她的丈夫。

sentences.english: Hours of gardening in the sun have quite tired me out.
sentences.chinese: 鋤草澆花已使我十分疲勞了。

sentences.english: Your mind is a mental garden, have you done any weeding lately?
sentences.chinese: 你的思維像是一個精神的花園，你最近給它鋤草了嗎？

sentences.english: Let me weed the ground with a hoe.
These days it\'s all weed killing, backache and wishes.
sentences.chinese: 這幾天不停地鋤草，背疼，祝願。

sentences.english: Every morning you can see him cultivating the corn .
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨你都可以看見他在給玉米鋤草鬆土。

sentences.english: That morning we worked from seven to eleven in the fields hoeing corn.
sentences.chinese: 這天早上，我們在玉米地鋤草，從。

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
